title: Nutty pancakes with stone fruit compote

ingredients.content: 2 nectarines, stones removed and flesh cut into eighths
2 yellow peaches, stones removed and flesh cut into eighths
1 vanilla bean, split lengthways and seeds scraped
2 pieces lemon peel (1 x 4 cm), no white pith
80 g Greek-style natural yoghurt, to serve (optional)

preparations.content: Place water into mixing bowl and place Varoma into position. Place nectarines, peaches, vanilla pod and seeds, syrup (optional), lemon peel and juice into a casserole dish (approx. 16 cm, ensuring dish fits comfortably into Varoma dish). Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Stir compote, then secure Varoma lid and steam for a further <b>5-10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b> or until fruit is tender (see Tips). Set compote aside until ready to serve (compote can be served warm or cold). Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place almonds and walnuts into mixing bowl and mill <b>8 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add remaining pancake ingredients, except oil, and mix <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>, until smooth.

Place a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and add a little of the oil. Pour Â¼ cup of the batter into frying pan and cook until bubbles appear on the surface start to burst (approx. 1-2 minutes). Flip pancake, then continue to fry for 1 minute, until golden and cooked through. Transfer into a thermal serving bowl or onto a plate and cover to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter to make approx. 10 pancakes.
Serve pancakes warm with compote, flaked almonds, yoghurt (optional) and honey (optional).

hintsAndTricks: Compote cooking time may vary depending on the ripeness of your fruit.
